ODAMNet
  • Input parameters for each approach
  • View page source

Input parameters for each approach

ODAMNet script

odamnet

[OPTIONS] = overlap | domino | multixrank | networkCreation

Analyse the relationship between chemicals and Rare Diseases. Select the approach you want to perform:

overlap | domino | multixrank

If you need to create a network with the pathways of interest, select : networkCreation

odamnet [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--version

Show the version and exit.

Commands

domino

Active Module Identification analysis

multixrank

Random Walk with Restart analysis

networkCreation

Network and its bipartite creation

overlap

Overlap analysis

Overlap

odamnet overlap

Perform overlap analysis between genes targeted by chemicals and Rare Diseases pathways.

odamnet overlap [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --chemicalsFile <chemicalsFile>

Chemicals file name

-r, --CTD_file <CTD_file>

CTD file name

-t, --targetGenesFile <targetGenesFile>

Target genes file name

--directAssociation <directAssociation>

True: Extract target genes from chemicals False: Extract target genes from chemicals + its child chemicals

Default:

True

--nbPub <nbPub>

Minimum number of publications to keep an interaction

Default:

2

--GMT <pathOfInterestGMT>

Pathways of interest file name (GMT file) NOTE: This argument is required if backgroundFile chosen.

--backgroundFile <backgroundFile>

Background genes file name NOTE: This argument is required if pathOfInterestGMT chosen.

-o, --outputPath <outputPath>

Output folder name to save results

Default:

OutputResults

DOMINO

odamnet domino

DOMINO defines target genes as active genes and search active modules (AM) through a given network. For each AM, an overlap analysis is performed against RD pathways (or pathways of interest).

odamnet domino [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --chemicalsFile <chemicalsFile>

Chemicals file name

-r, --CTD_file <CTD_file>

CTD file name

-t, --targetGenesFile <targetGenesFile>

Target genes file name

--directAssociation <directAssociation>

True: Extract target genes from chemicals False: Extract target genes from chemicals + its child chemicals

Default:

True

--nbPub <nbPub>

Minimum number of publications to keep an interaction

Default:

2

-n, --networkFile <FILENAME>

Required Network file name

--netUUID <networkUUID>

NDEx network ID

--GMT <pathOfInterestGMT>

Pathways of interest file name (GMT file) NOTE: This argument is required if backgroundFile chosen.

--backgroundFile <backgroundFile>

Background genes file name NOTE: This argument is required if pathOfInterestGMT chosen.

-o, --outputPath <outputPath>

Output folder name to save results

Default:

OutputResults

RWR

odamnet multixrank

Performs a Random Walk with Restart analysis through heterogeneous multilayer using the target genes as seeds.

odamnet multixrank [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --chemicalsFile <chemicalsFile>

Chemicals file name

-r, --CTD_file <CTD_file>

CTD file name

-t, --targetGenesFile <targetGenesFile>

Target genes file name

--directAssociation <directAssociation>

True: Extract target genes from chemicals False: Extract target genes from chemicals + its child chemicals

Default:

True

--nbPub <nbPub>

Minimum number of publications to keep an interaction

Default:

2

--configPath <configPath>

Required Configurations file path name

--networksPath <networksPath>

Required Network directory path

--seedsFile <FILENAME>

Required Seeds file path name

--sifFileName <FILENAME>

Required Name of the output file network SIF

--top <top>

Top number of results to write into output file

Default:

10

-o, --outputPath <outputPath>

Output folder name to save results

Default:

OutputResults

Network creation

odamnet networkCreation

Creates network SIF file from WP request or pathways of interest given in GMT file.

odamnet networkCreation [OPTIONS]

Options

--networksPath <networksPath>

Required Output path to save the network

--networksName <FILENAME>

Network output name

Default:

WP_RareDiseasesNetwork.sif

--bipartitePath <bipartitePath>

Required Output path to save the bipartite

--bipartiteName <FILENAME>

Bipartite output name

Default:

Bipartite_WP_RareDiseases_geneSymbols.tsv

--GMT <pathOfInterestGMT>

Pathways of interest in GMT like format (e.g. from WP request).

-o, --outputPath <outputPath>

Output path name (for complementary output files)

Default:

OutputResults

Important

--chemicalsFile, --CTD_file and --targetGenesFile parameters are exclusive, only one has to be use. This input is required.

Important

--backgroundFile and --GMT parameters have always to be given together.
